Inhalt:An seinem 11. Geburtstag erf√§hrt Harry Potter, der seit dem Tod seiner Eltern bei seiner Tante Petunia, seinem Onkel Vernon und seinem Cousin Dudley lebt, dass er ein Zauberer ist und dass er ab sofort an der Hogwarts-Schule f√ºr Hexerei und Zauberei alles √ºber Magie lernen darf. Ein Abenteuer beginnt, das ihm neue Freunde, wundersame Ereignisse, eine v√∂llig neue Welt, doch auch ungeahnte Gefahren beschert.Mein Eindruck:Ich habe die Harry Potter-B√ºcher bereits mehrmals in Deutsch und in Englisch gelesen sowie als H√∂rbuch geh√∂rt - und bin immer wieder begeistert. Im R√ºckblick ist der erste Band der Reihe der am wenigsten komplexe und am meisten kindgerechte, und J.K. Rowlings Stil ist noch nicht so ausgefeilt wie in den Folgeb√§nden. So haben sich in 'Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone' kleinere Logikfehler und eine gewisse, zu h√§ufig auftretende Affinit√§t zu bestimmten W√∂rtern eingeschlichen. Doch bereits in ihrem Erstling beweist die Autorin eine nahezu grenzenlose und wunderbare Fantasie, einen Sinn f√ºr Sprachwitz und zauberhafte Details sowie die F√§higkeit, Protagonisten komplex und glaubw√ºrdig zu charakterisieren.Das Buch ist im englischen Original auch f√ºr Nicht-Muttersprachler leicht zu verstehen und eine gute M√∂glichkeit, das Verst√§ndnis der englischen Sprache zu verbessern. Viele der Andeutungen, Witze, Bedeutungen von Namen etc. gehen zudem durch die √úbersetzung ins Deutsche verloren und k√∂nnen nur im englischen Original verstanden werden. Wenn man beide Ausgaben kennt, f√§llt zudem auf, dass es in der deutschen Version einige √úbersetzungsfehler gibt.Mein Res√ºmee:Ein Auftakt mit kleineren M√§ngeln. Wer in die Harry Potter-Welt einsteigen m√∂chte, nach dem ersten Buch jedoch noch nicht ganz in Rowlings Welt eintauchen konnte, sollte unbedingt dem n√§chsten Band eine Chance geben, denn Rowlings Geschichte wird deutlich anspruchsvoller, cleverer und komplexer als der erste Band ahnen l√§sst.

Um endlich meine Englischkenntnisse wieder auf Vordermann zu bringen habe ich mich entschlossen mir ein Harry Potter-Buch zu besorgen, da der Hype gerade auf dem H√∂hepunkt angelangt war. Mittlerweile habe ich das Buch vor 3 Tagen wieder in die Hand genommen und gerade eben ausgelesen - nicht, weil mein Englisch wieder eingerostet war, sondern weil auch ich mich als Erwachsener gerne in diese Welt voller Fantasie entf√ºhren lasse. Ich versuche logische Fragen (Wo in Rum√§nien leben die Drachen? Wurden sie mit einem Unsichtbarzauber belegt, um nicht gesehen zu werden? F√§llt den Muggeln wirklich gar nichts auf? Sind Muggel-Eltern nicht zutiefst schockiert, wenn ihr Kind nach Hogwarts gehen soll und keinen "anst√§ndigen" Beruf erlernt? Verkraften diese Eltern die Existenz einer solchen Welt wirklich so schnell?) hinten anzustellen. Man muss nicht immer alles erkl√§ren k√∂nnen (leider eine Unart der Erwachsenen). Diese B√ºcherreihe bietet die Gelegenheit das Kind im Erwachsenen wieder lebendig werden zu lassen. Da werden Geschichten erz√§hlt √ºber die Entstehung von Freundschaften, es werden Werte vermittelt, es werden √Ñngste beschrieben und √ºberstanden, es wird die Liebe als eine ungeheuer gro√üe Kraft beschrieben.Endlich k√∂nnen die Gro√üen, wenn sie es denn wollen, auch bei Kinderb√ºchern (au√üer M√§rchen, die ja eigentlich nicht wirklich f√ºr Kinder gedacht sind) fantastische Abenteuer mit vielen liebevollen, au√üergew√∂hnlichen Ideen der Autorin und einem gut durchdachten Handlungsbogen, erleben und mitfiebern, wie Harry Potter mit viel Gl√ºck und Unterst√ºtzung ein Abenteuer beginnt, welches noch weitere 6 B√ºcher umfassen soll.Und die Lesefertigkeit f√ºr die Harry Potter-Reihe muss nicht perfekt sein - schlie√ülich wurden die B√ºcher f√ºr Kinder geschrieben. Sie sind leicht verst√§ndlich und ein W√∂rterbuch ist kaum vonn√∂ten. Viele Vokabeln erkl√§ren sich durch das Lesen von selbst.

What a great beginning to a wonderfully enchanted series of books....A children's novel read secretly by just as many adults as that of prepubescent young minds. Each chapter equally magical and in bite-size chunks that are good for reading at bedtime or during a coffee or two. This is Harry Potter's first year at Hogwarts the school for wizards and witches, and 'the boy who lived', has a lot to learn in class. Realising that you are famous at the age of eleven after a dark lord has tried to kill you after taking the lives of your parents, being sent to stay at your aunt and uncle as a baby, and then being told when you start secondary school, you are actually a wizard like your father before you takes a while to sink in. On top of all that, you have to make friends and know your enemies, fight a troll, learn to play Quidditch and also defeat one or two teachers who are trying to murder you...oh and there are the end of year exams to pass unless you want to flunk magic.Definately a rewarding read for adults and children and have already bought the six continuing books in the set. As for the book design itself, these new covers are detailed with a scene from each book and the pages themselves are a great quality with the text a great size that I can read well without my glasses on..although after reading Harry Potter I think glasses are pretty cool!!!

Somethign in the description, when I bought this, led me to believe there were colourful pictures dotted throughout the book. Either I misread or was mislead, as ths is not the case. The cover picture is lovely, but that was it.Overall, there's no doubting the brilliance of the Harry Potter stories, but don't buy this expecting loads of colourful pictures like I did.

You know, I'm getting really sick of this. I haven't had this much of a problem with a book series since I started collecting Hercule Poirot. Every time I turn around the books are being rereleased and every time they are, the cover art is so much more fabulous than the last design. This isn't fair! I already own them, I shouldn't be repeatedly tempted to rebuy them! I only have so much restraint!Seriously, the series is fantastic and the cover art for this rerelease is the best yet. It'll make both a great present and splurge. And if you already own the series, I suppose you could always 'accidently' send out your current editions with the recycling and need to replace them.
Just amazing, worth every penny

I'm EXTREMELY happy with this seller. The book is in great conditions but the thing that most surprised and pleased me is that it arrived 5-9 days EARLIER. I don't know how that happened, I really don't. I ordered it two days ago, on the 8th of July, the estimated day of delivery was 15-19 july, but it came today! It's got my name on it so there's no doubt it's the one thatbI ordered.Now, the book itself is, as I said earlier, in great conditions. There's nothing wrong I could say about it, the print is amazing, pretty much everything's amazing. As a HP fan, I'm really excited to have it because it's a beautiful edition, but also my VERY OWN FIRST HP book.I'd recommend this seller to everyone, not just because of the delivery thing, but because of the condition of the book too!

Review title: 4 STELLE, Buon prezzo ma questa carta non mi soddisfa
Review: Non parlo della trama e di come sono scritti i libri, tutti conoscono la saga e il modo di scrivere dell'autrice.L'ARTWORK della copertina mi √® piaciuto molto pi√π della versione Italiana.Il FORMATO del libro √® tascabile, stava largo nel borsello da spiaggia (si me li sono portati in vacanza al mare).La CARTA utilizzata non √® delle migliori e sembrano tutti un pochettino fragili ma del resto a questo prezzo non pretendevo nulla di pi√π!Ho deciso di comprare la serie in Inglese perch√® dovevo prepararmi per il TOEIC ed erano consigliati come libri da leggere per crearsi delle buone basi. Per chi ha il mio stesso intento consiglio vivamente la saga di Harry Potter perch√® tutti i libri non hanno una sintassi difficile, dato il target di bambini/ragazzi che hanno i libri.Se si sono gi√† letti i libri in Italiano si otterranno dei buoni miglioramenti per il proprio lessico in Inglese, o almeno cos√¨ √® successo a me!4 STELLE bene Meritate!

Bei dem Preis √ºberlegt man schon zweimal, jedoch ist diese Ausgabe (f√ºr Sammler auf jeden Fall) jeden Cent wert. Sowohl der Schuber als auch das eigentliche Buch sind sehr hochwertig, die Illustrationen sind wundersch√∂n und die Seitenr√§nder goldfarben. Zus√§tzlich liegt noch eine gro√üe Faltkarte der Winkelgasse bei. Die Deluxe Ausgabe hat au√üerdem 11 Seiten mehr als die normale illustrated Edition und ist auch um einiges gr√∂√üer und schwerer.Hier noch anzumerken ist, dass das Buch auch sehr gut verpackt geliefert wurde (im eigentlichen Paket nochmal in einer bedruckten Pappverpackung), sodass es wirklich in einem unversehrten Zustand und ohne Transportspuren ankam.Wer nicht soviel Geld f√ºr ein Buch ausgeben m√∂chte, macht auch mit der "normalen" illustrated Edition nichts verkehrt (habe ich auch gekauft und verschenkt). Hier ist die Aufmachung nicht ganz so pomp√∂s, die Illustrationen d√ºrften aber die gleichen sein.

Habe dieses H√∂rbuch (neben den anderen von Harry Potter) f√ºr meinen Sohn gekauft. Ziel war, dass er die englische Aussprache und nat√ºrlich auch sein Vokalbelwissen verbessert. Nicht eine Sekunde w√ºrde ich z√∂gern diesen Kauf zu wiederholen: Mein Sohn hat sich im englischen so deutlich verbessert, dass er jetzt immer h√§ufiger englische Filme schaut, Nachrichten auf BBC sieht und seine letzte m√ºndliche englische Pr√ºfung (Business Englisch) mit Auszeichnung bestand - lieben Dank "Harry" :-)

In italiano √® meraviglioso, ma leggerlo in inglese √® tutta un'altra cosa! Soprattutto per chi, come me, vuole davvero capire le traduzioni fatte, dato che in italiano hanno un po' stravolto oggetti, cose, nomi delle persone. Favoloso! :-)

Review title: ... grandchild who is now hooked - makes birthday presents easy from now on
Review: A first Harry Potter book for a grandchild who is now hooked - makes birthday presents easy from now on !

The deluxe slipcase edition is beautiful! It was packaged perfectly, with a cardboard box that had the same snitch design as shown on the purple case, and the title written on the spine. Inside that, the book was wrapped in plastic. The book itself is extremely high quality - as in, the pages are so thick at first I thought they were stuck together, but soon got used to the fact that the paper itself was just very solid. The edges of the pages are coated in a very shiny gold (which does make the pages stick together a bit when new, just because the pages haven't been moved since they were coated). The book cover is covered in a nice material with a design of Diagon Alley - the same design which you receive in a long poster inside the book, which was a nice surprise.The illustrations are amazing and this edition is a must-have for any loving fan - or even as a great introduction to a younger person, though this book is very heavy. The darker parts of the story are not illustrated, which as an adult I am a bit sad about, as multiple pages in the later chapters have no pictures, but I understand it was done for children. I'm just an adult who bought this for herself on a whim, and I am so glad I did.

Review: The first time I tried to read the book was ten years ago. I couldn't finish it. Maybe it was my fault. I read it in Spanish and, taking into account that the first half of the book is a bit slow (sometimes boring), that could be the reason.However, I have tried again now, in English, and once you pass the first haundred pages, everything flow quick and the story become more a more interesting. by the last thirty pages I couldn't stop reading.To sum up, It is quite a good first book of the saga that has driven me to start the second one.7 out of 10.

Review: The print was too large & the cover may look like one of the American covers, but it's nothing compared to the original Scholastic version from 2006.The paperback cover just seems like a laminated sheet instead a textured cover with the title protruding out like the hardcovers. Review title: Mai visto niente di piu bello!
Review: Alla fine mi sono deciso di comprarlo, e devo dire che la lingua originale √® sempre un scalino piu in alto.Pagine belle e spesse, la carta √® sul grezzo quindi molto carina, una bella rilegatura non all'americana.La copertina √® fatta di un materiale fantastico, plastico, che si pu√≤ pulire, dallo sporco o dal'unto. Basta utilizzare della carta assorbente bagnata. il procedimento √®: NON GRATTARE, ma solo bagnare e asciugare, meglio senza sfregare troppo ma non ho riscontrato perdire di colore o altro..fantastica. Non usate troppa acqua per non rischiare di bagnare le pagine, per il resto come vi ho detto, la copertina non si rovina..non si impregna dell'acqua, che attenzione deve serivre solo a inumidire e ammoribidire lo sporco che poi andra tolto con dell'altra carta o un panno asciutto. Et Voil√†, come nuova!

As a big Harry Potter fan I must say the book is fantastic. I am from Switzerland and I love the way how J.K Rowling is writing the book. When I compare the movie with the book, I can‚Äôt tell which one is better. Both of them are great ! Here in the Philosopher Stone Harry, who lived with his aunt and uncle since a little kid, gets to know his whole story. He always thought that his parents had died in a car crash. He lived a terrible life with his relatives, but now he will see the truth. Harry learns that his parents died of an attack from one of the best wizards in the world but he survived. All people in this magical world know his name, Harry Potter, the kid who survived. He is talented as a wizard and goes to the school of witchcraft and wizardy, Hogwarts. I think it is a book for everyone who likes fantasy and action.

So you've read Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone? Whether you've read it or not, listening to it is delightful. I like to think I know the book pretty well, but listening to it I was able to pick up some details I had glossed over while reading. My children and I like listening to this in the car. It's great to be able to enjoy it as a family.We have heard both Stephen Fry's reading and Jim Dale's reading. Stephen wins our vote hands down. Jim Dale makes Hermione sound too whiny , Ginny Weasley sounds much the same. It is almost as if he is trying too hard to make sure he has a distinct voice for each character (something he has commneted on in interviews). Stephen Fry's reading is just perfect. If you are not accustomed to British accents it may take a little while to get used to it but its worth it.
Gran libro en ingles para mejorar si est√°n aprendiendo el idioma. De bolsillo y sencillo. Que m√°s pedir. Una peque√±a joya.

Ich liebe Harry Potter. Ich liebe die englische Sprache. Da bietet es sich doch an, die Buchreihe um Harry Potter mal in der Originalfassung zu lesen, dachte ich mir.Ich habe mir also direkt "Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone" auf mein Kindle geladen und komme seitdem nicht mehr davon weg.Es ist einfach zu lesen, weitaus einfacher, als ich es mir vorgestellt hatte - mein Sprachniveau in der englischen Sprache d√ºrfte sich ungef√§hr im B-Bereich bewegen. Man muss also nicht unbedingt ein Englischprofi sein, um hier beim Lesen gut voranzukommen.In der Kindleversion steht einem ansonsten die Option Word Wise zur Verf√ºgung, eine Hilfsfunktion f√ºr Englischlernende, bei der schwierige englische Vokabeln direkt √ºber dem betreffenden Wort erl√§utert werden.Au√üerdem hat man per Klick auf's Wort auch direkt die √úbersetzung zur Hand, was l√§stiges Nachschlagen im W√∂rterbuch √ºberfl√ºssig macht.Zum Buchcover kann ich leider nicht sehr viel sagen, da ich eben nur die E-Version besitze. Die Aufmachung, wie sie die Abbildung zeigt, ist aber meiner Meinung nach sehr h√ºbsch gestaltet.Ich kann das Buch jedem an's Herz legen, vor allem denjenigen, die die Handlung noch gar nicht kennen. Wobei die deutsche Version auch nicht zu verachten ist, beide sind toll geschrieben.Lasst euch verzaubern. It's a kind of magic. ;)

Review title: Obviously a brilliant read, so I'd give it 5 stars but ...
Review: Obviously a brilliant read, so I'd give it 5 stars but it does annoy me that for a children's book, there is no option to buy the Harry Potter series in bigger print, with pictures or even on CD (at a reasonable price).  My son is dyslexic and would love to be able to attempt to read this, but gets muddles too quickly, sore eyes and a headache.  So it's now down to me to act out all the characters, record it and type out in bigger print for him.  It's fine, it's just going to be time consuming!

Review title: Ein Buch das jeder einmal gelesen haben sollte!

It was the best book I have read in a long time, an instant classic.CHARACTERS - They felt real.There was a hook at the end of each chapter that kept me reading, and it never felt too fast or too slow.IMMERSION - Fully transported. Review title: My First Harry Potter at age 71!
Review: I had heard the name Harry Potter for a few years.  For some reason or another I made no attempt to find out what the fuss was all about. Fast Forward 10 years later and I have a set of 10 year old triplets. Harry, Voldemort, Hagrid and the Weasleys were common names I heard.  One night the triplets and their Dad were at my house and we needed a movie to watch. The name Harry Potter came up. I finally said I‚Äôm game and the rest is history. Less than a week ago I fell into Book one:  Harry Potter and the Sorcerer‚Äôs Stone.  There were times I had to make myself put the ebook down. This is one of the best books I have ever read. Now, if you will excuse me, I must return to Platform nine and three quarters for my return to Hogwarts.

Ho letto la versione italiana (in generale tutta la saga) pi√π di tre volte ma con l'inglese non sono un granch√®, per questo ho scelto questo libro, per aumentare il numero di termini nel mio vocabolario, cimentandomi per la prima volta nel leggere un libro in inglese aiutato dal fatto di sapere gi√† bene di cosa si sta parlando.Devo dire che √® stata un ottima esperienza sono riuscito a leggerlo tutto aiutandomi a tratti con il traduttore senza grosse difficolt√† e pi√π andavo avanti pi√π mi rendevo conto che la lettura era scorrevole, segno di un progressivo miglioramento (niente di mostruoso ma meglio di niente). Consiglio l'acquisto a chi voglia migliorare il proprio inglese alla prime armi.

Acquistato come libro di lettura in lingua per un ragazzo di 12 anni che conosce bene la grammatica inglese ma deve fare pratica e ampliare il vocabolario e per questo scopo √® perfetto. Il target √® quello, la storia √® appassionante, l'inglese non √® impossibile da comprendere. Per averli letti tutti posso dire che i libri successivi sono via via pi√π difficili, ma questo qui per un ragazzo di seconda media che segue lezioni di inglese dalla prima elementare con profitto √® ideale.

Ma non ne consiglio l'acquisto a chi abbia gi√† veduto il film, a meno che non abbia delle ragioni proprie per voler leggere il libro in lingua originale. Il film √® infatti fedele al libro sin nelle minime battute, cosicch√© chiunque abbia visto il film in italiano o a maggior ragione in lingua inglese non ci troverebbe nulla di che. A questo riguardo nutrivo grandi aspettative dal libro: credevo che il film avesse tagliato molto, come in genere accade, invece anche il libro √® molto povero di dettagli e di descrizioni capaci di creare il mondo in cui le vicende sono ambientate, di caratterizzare i personaggi, di consentire al lettore di immedesimarsi nei personaggi, e via dicendo. Naturalmente non mi aspettavo dall'opera la profondit√† di un Tolkien o la fedelt√† agli ambienti di Scott, ad esempio, ma neanche una simile assenza di atmosfera, per cos√¨ dire. Review title: To expensive for what you get
Review: While it is beautifully presented, i would have expected some extra illustrations compared to the other illustrated version.  there is an extra Diagon Alley piece, but nothing in the book that i can see.  It is very expensive for what you get.  I will probably return it.

I am reading this series because I promised my granddaughter I would read it while she was reading it.  I thought it would be a  chore.  However, instead, I have enjoyed every page.  Now I understand how my granddaughter plowed through the entire series in two weeks! Oh the exuberance of youth.
It's witchcraft!

Review title: A good foundation for the rest of the books
Review: This may be my second or third re-read of this first book in the 7 book Harry Potter series.  Still a good read after all these years.  This book was first published in 1997 so its 23 years old.The novel is well written with sympathetic characters, villainous antagonists (House of Slytherin), and a good plot (which is consistent both for the book as well as being spread across 7 books - no one in the story line knows about horcruxes yet).The story and Harry, Ron, and Hermione's skills are still primitive since their "first years" at Hogwarts.  Lots of room for growth and mastery.  Still the first appearance of Voldamort was effective, his face on the back of Quirrell's head.  I wonder if Voldamort ever felt about Quirrell's turban the way we sometimes feel about face masks ("I can't breathe" except that doctor's and nurses where more restrictive face masks every day and seem to do just fine).I'm looking forward to the next book.
It was about time I started reading the HP books, and it was just as I expected them to be : Magical

Review title: Now it has become a must-read
Review: Vividly described event after event, it's already been a while since the story lived with the mind of people of the world.If you want to be part of the world, you want to read at least this very base of Harry Potter series, so you'd understand what your friends, family and media are talking about.I also recommened this story to anyone who wants to learn widely accepted, common and practical English words and expressions.

I absolutely LOVE the Harry Potter series, and it is definitely one of my favorite series that I have ever read.  When I first started reading them I wasn't really sure that I would like them as I had unfortunately thought it was 'nerdy' when I was in school, and it was definitely a huge mistake!  It is still a very good read as an adult, but I really wish that I had started reading them when they came out.  I wanted my kids to be able to experience the magic of Harry Potter while they are young enough to believe in that kind of magic so we have started reading them together, and then watching the movie that coincides with the book.  They love the series as well though I don't think they like it as much as me since my daughter 'teases' me about it.  :)This book is captivating from the very first sentence.  J.K. Rowling is a very gifted writer and is descriptive enough to be able to transport you to her world without being so wordy that you find yourself losing interest.  If you have not read this book yet then read it!  You will not be disappointed.

Amazing doesn't quite fit this book. Though stupendous, inspiring, wonderful and incredible don't quite describe it either it is so much better than all these words put together. If you have not read this book please pick it up. Do not let anyone else's negative opinion keep you from reading this book. It has so much going for it. It's about friendship, bravery, courage, love, family and so many other good things. The magic of Harry Potter has reached all over the world and touched a lot of hearts.Remember "It is our choices, that decide who we truly are far more than our abilities."

Review title: Do not buy it!!!! Zero stars if it was possible.
Review: Super mad! This book is not put together correctly.  For example, page?  #100 ends and picks back up at page #99. I bought this for my daughters 5th grade class and am super embarrassed.  Editors pick? Seriously?

I purchased this as a used product, so let me start by staying I had no expectation this book would be in perfect condition. The book was advertised as follows "Condition: Used - Good - Pages and cover are intact. Used book in good and clean conditions. Limited notes/marks and highlighting may be present. May show signs of normal shelf wear and bends on edges..." When I received the book, the cover was in good condition, but the interior pages were in very poor condition. Forget limited notes/highlights or creased edges...it looks like someone took an x-acto knife and randomly sliced through different chapters of the book in different directions. The first few chapters are barely readable in that condition. It's difficult to turn the pages without them falling apart. The further you get through the book, the better the book's condition gets. If the book's condition was more accurately described, I wouldn't have purchased it.

Review title: The book that started it all
Review: This is, of course, the book that launched the multi-billion dollar franchise about the orphaned boy named Harry Potter that finds out he is a Wizard when he turns 10 years old, and has been accepted to Hogwart's School for Witches and Wizards. It would eventually spawn seven books, eight movies, a spin-off series, and a play. For the few who do not know the story, this book basically establishes Harry learning that his parents were Wizards and killed by an evil wizard named Voldemort, who also tried to kill Harry as an infant. The attempt to kill Harry failed, and Harry was sent by Albus Dumbledore, the headmaster of Hogwarts to live with his aunt and uncle and then chronicles his first year at Hogwarts where he meets two schoolmates who would become his best friends, Ron Weasley and Hermoine Granger.For those who have seen the movie but have not yet read the book, this is the shortest of the novels so it has the least amount of material removed in the movie adaptation. That said, the movie did change some things and did shorten some sequences. For example, the opening sequence with the Dursleys is more extended in the novel and things like the trip to the zoo play out a bit differently than was shown in the movie. But, all the main plot points from the book ended up in the movie, especially once Harry gets to Hogwarts, so that will not be much different.The book is age-appropriate for kids about 10-11 years old and up. Rowling intended that the kids reading it would be about the same age as the characters in the book, so for the first novel around 10-11 years old. The books get increasingly darker and more adult with each new book, but really for this book a kid only really needs to understand the concept of death and "good guys" versus "bad guys". Otherwise, the novel is pretty tame. It has a good blend of humor, action, and suspense, and touches on themes of family, friends, right vs. wrong, and the like. Even though it is technically a "kids book" it is enjoyable enough for an adult, and even though it was written in the mid to late 1990s, it holds up well enough to be enjoyable even years later. It can easily be enjoyed by people in their 20s, 30s, 40s, etc., whether your first experience with the Harry Potter universe was as a young kid, as a teenager, or (as in my case) as an adult because of watching the movies. And, because it is only a few hundred pages and meant for young kids to be able to read it, adults who are fairly quick readers can probably get through it in a couple of days without a problemUltimately, by now anyone reading this likely knows enough about Harry Potter to know the overall story and knows whether they like it or not. But, if you are just getting introduced to the series and are looking at the reviews if you are into fantasy novels or themes like magic, this is definitely worth reading. While it is nowhere near the best book of the series, it does a good job establishing the main characters, telling the stand-alone portion of the story, inviting the Sorcerer's Stone, and setting up what is to come down the line.

Review: The book was written on and not suitable as a gift

Review title: why didn‚Äôt I read this sooner???
Review: I never understood why Harry Potter was so popular. I didn‚Äôt get it.So, recently I needed something to watch for background noise while working. I had already watched all episodes of the Office and Psych, so fine, Harry Potter it was.I enjoyed the movie so much I knew the book had to be better. The books are ALWAYS better than the movie.Just finished book one and even though I knew how it ended it was still an excellent read. I laughed. I cried (tears off joy). I entered a world entirely different from my own, yet not really, and it was worth it.I plan to read them all.This book would be safe for preteens/teens as it‚Äôs not really scary. Also, great for homeschooled kids.

Unfortunately, this book was linked to the ad for a large print book, but it was just the regular HP scholastic book we have at the middle school I work at.I was quickly refunded my money and was asked to donate the book, so I gave it the the school library.

Review title: The magic is better than ever in this reread eleven years from my first read
Review: It goes without saying how awesome this book and the whole following series is. I read this so long ago when the movies were just starting, so I guess my first read of it was in 2010 which was way before I had a Goodreads account.It's just so fun to disappear into Harry's world especially when he escapes the Dursley household for the school year and all his amazing new friends...and some schoolmates who weren't so nice. I remember picturing all the characters, somewhat, but the movies did help enhance the books for me bringing the individual characters to life. This is one book even when reread that you want to be sure you have all day to read, because the same wonderful magic that was there for me the first read was there on an even greater scale for this reread eleven years later (and maybe a few random rereads in between!)

This book now is number 1 in my big book collection! This book was very suspenseful and funny!  ONE of my favorite parts was where he played quidditch! It told about every second of it! I wasn‚Äôt really a big fan of Harry Potter until I started reading the first book! I really recommend reading this! It‚Äôs a magical and suspenseful ride even if you already watched the first movie.

Well-made book and good price. Large Print Type is 16 point sarif font. We will have to see if this is big enough for my legally-blind son. He may need magnifiers even for this, but easier than the standard print that‚Äôs more like Times New Roman 12

I read this book when I was about 11 years old. I had never read a book harder than the Magic Tree House until I picked this one up, and once I did, I never put it down. This book has humor, good vocabulary, and it's a great experience. I read it again a few days ago and realized just how good these books really are almost 8 years later. I've read the Eragon series, Lord of the Rings, and all kinds of great literature pieces. But this book and this series will always be a classic for me, and I hope that if you read this review as a parent or someone who wants to read this that you give it a shot. I can assure you, this book is great and you won't regret reading this book.

A very exciting adventure, even for a 27 year old man. It was even better than I had expected after all these years. I, like many American millennials growing up in the 90‚Äôs, was one of the children who were not allowed to read Harry Potter for illogical beliefs held by their parents. The books were considered evil, and you would be punished or taken to see a counselor if you were caught with one. It is because of this that I read these books most unlike my friends over 2 decades prior in their childhood. The thrill of talking about such an amazing children‚Äôs book with your friends is now lost, no longer to hold the same magic as it once did. In simpler days before we had computers and social media at everyone‚Äôs fingertips, speaking in person with all your friends about all the latest popular things held so much more value than in this day and age. Those were cherished times. So with that being said, no, this book for those like me will never hold a candle to the flame of ages past. But even so, what an amazing feeling it is to read this book. Apart from the usual excitement and suspense, a very different emotion is felt. What can only be described as saudade, a kind of melancholic nostalgia, it makes one wish they could return to a happy time they never got to experience. Thank you for this opportunity to share what my heart has held onto for far too long.

Review title: A page turner, fun, nothing transcendent
Review: This was a fun and very fast read.  I believe it was originally written for a younger audience, and it shows, with a lot of transparently silly names for people, places and things.  There is a lot of detail in some aspects, almost none in others.  As escapist fantasy work goes, this is better than most, but I'm not sure I'll read the rest of the series (even though it is set up to encourage exactly that).My question (and this has probably been written about extensively by those more invested in this series than I could ever be):  Why do these folks celebrate Christmas and Easter?

it's not as if this is my fave series but Harry Potter is pretty good. my personal favourite in hp would probably be Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets.anyways, this book's prologue is about how lily and james, Harry's parents died.then eleven years later, harry received his letter to go to Hogwarts, a magical school.but, as uncle vernon tore it in pieces, harry didnt read the letter.then uncle Vernon got sick of the letters so they went abroad .a giant named hagrid broke in and told harry everything about the wizarding world.fave parts:Hermione : it's wingardium leviosar!Hermione : now I'm going to bed before you get another clever idea to get us killed, or  worse , expelled .thx for reading!

Guided by Hagrid into the magical world where he meets Ron, Hermione, Dumbledore and others. He starts his journey to become a wizard and learns about his family. Wonderful story, great characters and situations. Have read the series several times, seen the movies. I liked going back to see what was changed, quite a bit.

While others may have expressed their love of this book, it is unlikely they could disclose the secret Ms. Rowling carries in her bosom‚Äî-she has the stone! In this day and age, the kind of wealth it can generate would gain the immediate attention of the authorities! Money laundering, drug running, a curse more than a blessing! Jail time, lawyer fees!Thus, the stone gifts her these magical books, to fob off as if written by a muggle. Magic hides in plan sight. Very clever. Very clever indeed!

The book was easy to read, but clearly not very advanced. With the advantage of knowing what is coming, the ending conversation with Professor Dumbledore almost led me to give the book another star.This is my first time reading these books since maybe 1999, and there isn‚Äôt anything particularly spectacular about this book for me. I am more of an Artemis Fowl fan when it comes to the first book. This book just gets more hype because it builds into a much more powerful overarching story. The Sorcerer‚Äôs Stone, as a stand-alone, was just okay for me. Still a fun, easy read.

Mrs. Rowling's humor in the pages was by far much better in the book and I found myself laughing so hard I found myself with tears. The characters are ones that stick with you and now I will move forward to the next in the series.
